CloudJob CloudJob Class

Definition

Namespace:
Microsoft.Azure.Batch
Assembly:
Azure.Batch.dll

An Azure Batch job.

Edit

In this Article

Properties

CommonEnvironmentSettings CommonEnvironmentSettings

Edit

Gets or sets a list of common environment variable settings. These environment variables are set for all tasks in this CloudJob (including the Job Manager, Job Preparation and Job Release tasks).

public IList<EnvironmentSetting> CommonEnvironmentSettings { get; set; }Public Property CommonEnvironmentSettings As IList(Of EnvironmentSetting)
Value
IList<EnvironmentSetting> IList(Of EnvironmentSetting)

Constraints Constraints

Edit

Gets or sets the execution constraints for the job.

public JobConstraints Constraints { get; set; }Public Property Constraints As JobConstraints
Value
JobConstraints JobConstraints

CreationTime CreationTime

Edit

Gets the creation time of the job.

public DateTime? CreationTime { get; }Public ReadOnly Property CreationTime As Date?
Value
Nullable<DateTime> Nullable(Of DateTime)

CustomBehaviors CustomBehaviors

Edit

Gets or sets a list of behaviors that modify or customize requests to the Batch service made via this CloudJob.

public IList<BatchClientBehavior> CustomBehaviors { get; set; }Public Property CustomBehaviors As IList(Of BatchClientBehavior)
Value
IList<BatchClientBehavior> IList(Of BatchClientBehavior)

Remarks

These behaviors are inherited by child objects.

Modifications are applied in the order of the collection. The last write wins.

DisplayName DisplayName

Edit

Gets or sets the display name of the job.

Value
String String

ETag ETag

Edit

Gets the ETag for the job.

String String

Edit

Gets the execution information for the job.

Value
JobExecutionInformation JobExecutionInformation

Id Id

Edit

Gets or sets the id of the job.

public string Id { get; set; }Public Property Id As String
Value
String String

JobManagerTask JobManagerTask

Edit

Gets or sets the Job Manager task. The Job Manager task is launched when the CloudJob is started.

public JobManagerTask JobManagerTask { get; set; }Public Property JobManagerTask As JobManagerTask
Value
JobManagerTask JobManagerTask

JobPreparationTask JobPreparationTask

Edit

Gets or sets the Job Preparation task. The Batch service will run the Job Preparation task on a compute node before starting any tasks of that job on that compute node.

public JobPreparationTask JobPreparationTask { get; set; }Public Property JobPreparationTask As JobPreparationTask
Value
JobPreparationTask JobPreparationTask

JobReleaseTask JobReleaseTask

Edit

Gets or sets the Job Release task. The Batch service runs the Job Release task when the job ends, on each compute node where any task of the job has run.

public JobReleaseTask JobReleaseTask { get; set; }Public Property JobReleaseTask As JobReleaseTask
Value
JobReleaseTask JobReleaseTask

Edit

Gets the last modified time of the job.

public DateTime? LastModified { get; }Public ReadOnly Property LastModified As Date?
Value
Nullable<DateTime> Nullable(Of DateTime)

Edit

Gets or sets a list of name-value pairs associated with the job as metadata.

Value
IList<MetadataItem> IList(Of MetadataItem)

OnAllTasksComplete OnAllTasksComplete

Edit

Gets or sets the action the Batch service should take when all tasks in the job are in the Completed state.

public OnAllTasksComplete? OnAllTasksComplete { get; set; }Public Property OnAllTasksComplete As OnAllTasksComplete?
Value
Nullable<OnAllTasksComplete> Nullable(Of OnAllTasksComplete)

OnTaskFailure OnTaskFailure

Edit

Gets or sets the action the Batch service should take when any task in the job fails.

public OnTaskFailure? OnTaskFailure { get; set; }Public Property OnTaskFailure As OnTaskFailure?
Value
Nullable<OnTaskFailure> Nullable(Of OnTaskFailure)

Remarks

A task is considered to have failed if it completes with a non-zero exit code and has exhausted its retry count, or if it had a scheduling error.

PoolInformation PoolInformation

Edit

Gets or sets the pool on which the Batch service runs the job's tasks.

public PoolInformation PoolInformation { get; set; }Public Property PoolInformation As PoolInformation
Value
PoolInformation PoolInformation

PreviousState PreviousState

Edit

Gets the previous state of the job.

public JobState? PreviousState { get; }Public ReadOnly Property PreviousState As JobState?
Value
Nullable<JobState> Nullable(Of JobState)

Remarks

If the job is in its initial Active state, the PreviousState property is not defined.

PreviousStateTransitionTime PreviousStateTransitionTime

Edit

Gets the time at which the job entered its previous state.

public DateTime? PreviousStateTransitionTime { get; }Public ReadOnly Property PreviousStateTransitionTime As Date?
Value
Nullable<DateTime> Nullable(Of DateTime)

Remarks

If the job is in its initial Active state, the PreviousStateTransitionTime property is not defined.

Priority Priority

Edit

Gets or sets the priority of the job. Priority values can range from -1000 to 1000, with -1000 being the lowest priority and 1000 being the highest priority.

public int ? Priority { get; set; }Public Property Priority As Integer?
Value
Nullable<Int32> Nullable(Of Int32)

Remarks

The default value is 0.

State State

Edit

Gets the current state of the job.

public JobState? State { get; }Public ReadOnly Property State As JobState?
Value
Nullable<JobState> Nullable(Of JobState)

StateTransitionTime StateTransitionTime

Edit

Gets the time at which the job entered its current state.

public DateTime? StateTransitionTime { get; }Public ReadOnly Property StateTransitionTime As Date?
Value
Nullable<DateTime> Nullable(Of DateTime)

Statistics Statistics

Edit

Gets resource usage statistics for the entire lifetime of the job.

public JobStatistics Statistics { get; }Public ReadOnly Property Statistics As JobStatistics
Value
JobStatistics JobStatistics

Remarks

This property is populated only if the CloudJob was retrieved with an ExpandClause including the 'stats' attribute; otherwise it is null.

Url Url

Edit

Gets the URL of the job.

public string Url { get; }Public ReadOnly Property Url As String
Value
String String

UsesTaskDependencies UsesTaskDependencies

Edit

Gets or sets whether tasks in the job can define dependencies on each other.

public bool ? UsesTaskDependencies { get; set; }Public Property UsesTaskDependencies As Boolean?
Value
Nullable<Boolean> Nullable(Of Boolean)

Remarks

The default value is false.

Methods

AddTask(CloudTask, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>) AddTask(CloudTask, IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior))

Edit

Adds a single task to this CloudJob. To add multiple tasks, use AddTask(String, IEnumerable<CloudTask>, BatchClientParallelOptions, ConcurrentBag<ConcurrentDictionary<Type, IFileStagingArtifact>>, Nullable<TimeSpan>, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>).

public ConcurrentDictionary<Type, IFileStagingArtifact> AddTask(CloudTask taskToAdd, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null)Public Function AddTask(taskToAdd As CloudTask, additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing) As ConcurrentDictionary(Of Type, IFileStagingArtifact)
Parameters
taskToAdd
CloudTask CloudTask

The CloudTask to add.

additionalBehaviors
IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior)

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the CustomBehaviors.

Returns
ConcurrentDictionary<Type, IFileStagingArtifact> ConcurrentDictionary(Of Type, IFileStagingArtifact)

A collection of information about the file staging process (see FilesToStage). For more information see IFileStagingArtifact.

Remarks

Each call to this method incurs a request to the Batch service. Therefore, using this method to add multiple tasks is less efficient than using a bulk add method, and can incur HTTP connection restrictions. If you are performing many of these operations in parallel and are seeing client side timeouts, please see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.net.servicepointmanager.defaultconnectionlimit%28v=vs.110%29.aspx or use JobOperations.AddTask.

This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see AddTaskAsync(CloudTask, ConcurrentDictionary<Type, IFileStagingArtifact>, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken).

AddTask(IEnumerable<CloudTask>, BatchClientParallelOptions, ConcurrentBag<ConcurrentDictionary<Type, IFileStagingArtifact>>, Nullable<TimeSpan>, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>) AddTask(IEnumerable(Of CloudTask), BatchClientParallelOptions, ConcurrentBag(Of ConcurrentDictionary(Of Type, IFileStagingArtifact)), Nullable(Of TimeSpan), IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior))

Edit

Adds tasks to a job.

public void AddTask(IEnumerable<CloudTask> tasksToAdd, BatchClientParallelOptions parallelOptions = null, ConcurrentBag<ConcurrentDictionary<Type, IFileStagingArtifact>> fileStagingArtifacts = null, TimeSpan? timeout = null, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null)Public Sub AddTask(tasksToAdd As IEnumerable(Of CloudTask), parallelOptions As BatchClientParallelOptions = Nothing, fileStagingArtifacts As ConcurrentBag(Of ConcurrentDictionary(Of Type, IFileStagingArtifact)) = Nothing, timeout As TimeSpan? = Nothing, additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing)
Parameters
tasksToAdd
IEnumerable<CloudTask> IEnumerable(Of CloudTask)

The CloudTasks to add.

parallelOptions
BatchClientParallelOptions BatchClientParallelOptions

Controls the number of simultaneous parallel AddTaskCollection requests issued to the Batch service. Each AddTaskCollection request contains at most MaxTasksInSingleAddTaskCollectionRequest tasks in it. Also controls the cancellation token for the operation. If omitted, the default is used (see BatchClientParallelOptions.)

fileStagingArtifacts
ConcurrentBag<ConcurrentDictionary<Type, IFileStagingArtifact>> ConcurrentBag(Of ConcurrentDictionary(Of Type, IFileStagingArtifact))

An optional collection to receive information about the file staging process (see FilesToStage). An entry is added to the ConcurrentBag<T> for each set of tasks grouped for submission to the Batch service. Unlike single-task adds, you cannot use this parameter to customize the file staging process. For more information about the format of each entry, see IFileStagingArtifact.

timeout
Nullable<TimeSpan> Nullable(Of TimeSpan)

The amount of time after which the operation times out.

additionalBehaviors
IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior)

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the CustomBehaviors.

Exceptions
ParallelOperationsException ParallelOperationsException

Thrown if one or more requests to the Batch service fail.

Remarks

This is a blocking operation; for a non-blocking equivalent, see AddTaskAsync(IEnumerable<CloudTask>, BatchClientParallelOptions, ConcurrentBag<ConcurrentDictionary<Type, IFileStagingArtifact>>, Nullable<TimeSpan>, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>).

This method is not atomic; that is, it is possible for the method to start adding tasks and then fail. The collection of tasks to add is broken down into chunks of size at most MaxTasksInSingleAddTaskCollectionRequest, and an AddTaskCollection request is issued for each chunk. Requests may be issued in parallel according to the parallelOptions.

Issuing a large number of simultaneous requests to the Batch service can incur HTTP connection restrictions. If you are performing many of these operations in parallel (or have specified a large MaxDegreeOfParallelism in the parallelOptions) and are seeing client side timeouts, please see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.net.servicepointmanager.defaultconnectionlimit%28v=vs.110%29.aspx .

The progress of the operation in the face of errors is determined by AddTaskCollectionResultHandler behavior. You do not normally need to specify this behavior, as the Batch client uses a default which works in normal circumstances. If you do want to customize this behavior, specify an AddTaskCollectionResultHandler in the CustomBehaviors or additionalBehaviors collections.

AddTaskAsync(CloudTask, ConcurrentDictionary<Type, IFileStagingArtifact>, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken) AddTaskAsync(CloudTask, ConcurrentDictionary(Of Type, IFileStagingArtifact), IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior), CancellationToken)

Edit

Adds a single task to this CloudJob. To add multiple tasks, use AddTaskAsync(String, IEnumerable<CloudTask>, BatchClientParallelOptions, ConcurrentBag<ConcurrentDictionary<Type, IFileStagingArtifact>>, Nullable<TimeSpan>, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>).

public Task AddTaskAsync(CloudTask taskToAdd, ConcurrentDictionary<Type, IFileStagingArtifact> allFileStagingArtifacts = null, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = null)Public Function AddTaskAsync(taskToAdd As CloudTask, allFileStagingArtifacts As ConcurrentDictionary(Of Type, IFileStagingArtifact) = Nothing, additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing, cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task
Parameters
taskToAdd
CloudTask CloudTask

The CloudTask to add.

allFileStagingArtifacts
ConcurrentDictionary<Type, IFileStagingArtifact> ConcurrentDictionary(Of Type, IFileStagingArtifact)

An optional collection to customize and receive information about the file staging process (see FilesToStage). For more information see IFileStagingArtifact.

additionalBehaviors
IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior)

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the CustomBehaviors.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.

Returns
Task Task

A Task that represents the asynchronous operation.

Remarks

Each call to this method incurs a request to the Batch service. Therefore, using this method to add multiple tasks is less efficient than using a bulk add method, and can incur HTTP connection restrictions. If you are performing many of these operations in parallel and are seeing client side timeouts, please see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.net.servicepointmanager.defaultconnectionlimit%28v=vs.110%29.aspx or use JobOperations.AddTaskAsync.

The add task operation runs asynchronously.

AddTaskAsync(IEnumerable<CloudTask>, BatchClientParallelOptions, ConcurrentBag<ConcurrentDictionary<Type, IFileStagingArtifact>>, Nullable<TimeSpan>, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>) AddTaskAsync(IEnumerable(Of CloudTask), BatchClientParallelOptions, ConcurrentBag(Of ConcurrentDictionary(Of Type, IFileStagingArtifact)), Nullable(Of TimeSpan), IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior))

Edit

Adds tasks to a job.

public Task AddTaskAsync(IEnumerable<CloudTask> tasksToAdd, BatchClientParallelOptions parallelOptions = null, ConcurrentBag<ConcurrentDictionary<Type, IFileStagingArtifact>> fileStagingArtifacts = null, TimeSpan? timeout = null, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null)Public Function AddTaskAsync(tasksToAdd As IEnumerable(Of CloudTask), parallelOptions As BatchClientParallelOptions = Nothing, fileStagingArtifacts As ConcurrentBag(Of ConcurrentDictionary(Of Type, IFileStagingArtifact)) = Nothing, timeout As TimeSpan? = Nothing, additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing) As Task
Parameters
tasksToAdd
IEnumerable<CloudTask> IEnumerable(Of CloudTask)

The CloudTasks to add.

parallelOptions
BatchClientParallelOptions BatchClientParallelOptions

Controls the number of simultaneous parallel AddTaskCollection requests issued to the Batch service. Each AddTaskCollection request contains at most MaxTasksInSingleAddTaskCollectionRequest tasks in it. Also controls the cancellation token for the operation. If omitted, the default is used (see BatchClientParallelOptions.)

fileStagingArtifacts
ConcurrentBag<ConcurrentDictionary<Type, IFileStagingArtifact>> ConcurrentBag(Of ConcurrentDictionary(Of Type, IFileStagingArtifact))

An optional collection to receive information about the file staging process (see FilesToStage). An entry is added to the ConcurrentBag<T> for each set of tasks grouped for submission to the Batch service. Unlike single-task adds, you cannot use this parameter to customize the file staging process. For more information about the format of each entry, see IFileStagingArtifact.

timeout
Nullable<TimeSpan> Nullable(Of TimeSpan)

The amount of time after which the operation times out.

additionalBehaviors
IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior)

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the CustomBehaviors.

Returns
Task Task

A Task object that represents the asynchronous operation.

Exceptions
ParallelOperationsException ParallelOperationsException

Thrown if one or more requests to the Batch service fail.

Remarks

The add task operation runs asynchronously.

This method is not atomic; that is, it is possible for the method to start adding tasks and then fail. The collection of tasks to add is broken down into chunks of size at most MaxTasksInSingleAddTaskCollectionRequest, and an AddTaskCollection request is issued for each chunk. Requests may be issued in parallel according to the parallelOptions.

Issuing a large number of simultaneous requests to the Batch service can incur HTTP connection restrictions. If you are performing many of these operations in parallel (or have specified a large MaxDegreeOfParallelism in the parallelOptions) and are seeing client side timeouts, please see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.net.servicepointmanager.defaultconnectionlimit%28v=vs.110%29.aspx .

The progress of the operation in the face of errors is determined by AddTaskCollectionResultHandler behavior. You do not normally need to specify this behavior, as the Batch client uses a default which works in normal circumstances. If you do want to customize this behavior, specify an AddTaskCollectionResultHandler in the CustomBehaviors or additionalBehaviors collections.

Commit(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>) Commit(IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior))

Edit

Commits this CloudJob to the Azure Batch service.

public void Commit(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null)Public Sub Commit(additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing)
Parameters
additionalBehaviors
IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior)

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the CustomBehaviors.

Remarks

If the CloudJob already exists on the Batch service, its properties are replaced by the properties of this CloudJob.

This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see CommitAsync(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken).

CommitAsync(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken) CommitAsync(IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior), CancellationToken)

Edit

Commits this CloudJob to the Azure Batch service.

Parameters
additionalBehaviors
IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior)

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the CustomBehaviors.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.

Returns
Task Task

A Task that represents the asynchronous operation.

Remarks

If the CloudJob already exists on the Batch service, its properties are replaced by the properties of this CloudJob.

The commit operation runs asynchronously.

CommitChanges(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>) CommitChanges(IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior))

Edit

Commits all pending changes to this CloudJob to the Azure Batch service.

public void CommitChanges(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null)Public Sub CommitChanges(additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing)
Parameters
additionalBehaviors
IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior)

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the CustomBehaviors.

Remarks

Updates an existing CloudJob on the Batch service by replacing its properties with the properties of this CloudJob which have been changed. Unchanged properties are ignored. All changes since the last time this entity was retrieved from the Batch service (either via Refresh(DetailLevel, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>), GetJob(String, DetailLevel, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>), or ListJobs(DetailLevel, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>)) are applied. Properties which are explicitly set to null will cause an exception because the Batch service does not support partial updates which set a property to null. If you need to set a property to null, use Commit(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>).

This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see CommitChangesAsync(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken).

CommitChangesAsync(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken) CommitChangesAsync(IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior), CancellationToken)

Edit

Commits all pending changes to this CloudJob to the Azure Batch service.

Parameters
additionalBehaviors
IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior)

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the CustomBehaviors.

cancellationToken
CancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken for controlling the lifetime of the asynchronous operation.

Returns
Task Task

A Task that represents the asynchronous operation.

Remarks

Updates an existing CloudJob on the Batch service by replacing its properties with the properties of this CloudJob which have been changed. Unchanged properties are ignored. All changes since the last time this entity was retrieved from the Batch service (either via Refresh(DetailLevel, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>), GetJob(String, DetailLevel, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>), or ListJobs(DetailLevel, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>)) are applied. Properties which are explicitly set to null will cause an exception because the Batch service does not support partial updates which set a property to null. If you need to set a property to null, use Commit(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>).

This operation runs asynchronously.

Delete(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>) Delete(IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior))

Edit

Deletes this CloudJob.

public void Delete(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null)Public Sub Delete(additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing)
Parameters
additionalBehaviors
IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior)

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the CustomBehaviors.

Remarks

The delete operation requests that the job be deleted. The request puts the job in the Deleting state. The Batch service will stop any running tasks and perform the actual job deletion without any further client action.

This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see DeleteAsync(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken).

DeleteAsync(IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken) DeleteAsync(IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior), CancellationToken)

Edit

Task Task

The delete operation requests that the job be deleted. The request puts the job in the Deleting state. The Batch service will stop any running tasks and perform the actual job deletion without any further client action.

The delete operation runs asynchronously.

ListTasks(DetailLevel, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>) ListTasks(DetailLevel, IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior))

Edit

Enumerates the CloudTask of this CloudJob.

public IPagedEnumerable<CloudTask> ListTasks(DetailLevel detailLevel = null, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null)Public Function ListTasks(detailLevel As DetailLevel = Nothing, additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing) As IPagedEnumerable(Of CloudTask)
Parameters
detailLevel
DetailLevel DetailLevel

A DetailLevel used for filtering the list and for controlling which properties are retrieved from the service.

additionalBehaviors
IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior)

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the CustomBehaviors and detailLevel.

Returns
IPagedEnumerable<CloudTask> IPagedEnumerable(Of CloudTask)

An IPagedEnumerable<T> that can be used to enumerate tasks asynchronously or synchronously.

Remarks

This method returns immediately; the tasks are retrieved from the Batch service only when the collection is enumerated. Retrieval is non-atomic; tasks are retrieved in pages during enumeration of the collection.

Terminate(String, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>) Terminate(String, IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior))

Edit

Terminates this CloudJob, marking it as completed.

public void Terminate(string terminateReason = null, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> additionalBehaviors = null)Public Sub Terminate(terminateReason As String = Nothing, additionalBehaviors As IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior) = Nothing)
Parameters
terminateReason
String String

The text you want to appear as the job's TerminateReason.

additionalBehaviors
IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior> IEnumerable(Of BatchClientBehavior)

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied to the Batch service request after the CustomBehaviors.

Remarks

This is a blocking operation. For a non-blocking equivalent, see TerminateAsync(String, IEnumerable<BatchClientBehavior>, CancellationToken).
